column2: Tindak Malaysia (2025), Laporan Pilihan Raya Umum Dewan Undangan Negeri Sarawak yang Kelapan, 2001 .  For more information, please refer to SARAWAK_2001_Other_Sources_DUN_File

There are gaps in the age data for the candidates. There are missing Independent symbols.  There are discrepancies for DUN Belaga data if one follows the Election Commission report (The report claims Total Ballots Issued is 4193, turnout is 64.75% and winning majority is 1324. DAP withdrew from Barisan Alternatif in September 2001 and Barisan Alternatif is made up of PAS, PKN and PRM. Despite PAS and PKR are in the same coalition, they did clash in one seat. PKN and DAP had negotiation for one-to-one fight against BN in certain constituencies but clashes emerged. TindakMalaysia Network Services PLT is not responsible for any errors or omissions arising from the original data or its derivatives.
